name: Rumtek Monastery
summary: Seat of the Karma Kagyu lineage, known for its grandeur and sacred relics.
description: Rumtek Monastery, also known as the Dharma Chakra Centre, is one of the most significant monasteries in Sikkim. Its architecture reflects traditional Tibetan styles.

name: Pemayangtse Monastery
summary: One of Sikkim’s oldest monasteries, with exquisite sculptures and murals.
description: Pemayangtse is renowned for its ancient heritage and artistic treasures, including the intricately carved Sangtok Palri model.

name: Enchey Monastery
summary: A serene monastery overlooking Gangtok, associated with the Nyingma order.
description: Enchey Monastery means the 'solitary temple'. It is believed to be blessed by Lama Drupthob Karpo, a tantric master known for levitation.

name: Dubdi Monastery
summary: The oldest monastery in Sikkim, founded by Lhatsun Namkha Jigme.
description: Dubdi Monastery, also called the 'Hermit’s Cell', was established in 1701 after the coronation of the first Chogyal. It is an important part of Sikkim’s Buddhist heritage.

name: Lingdum Monastery
summary: A modern monastery known for its grandeur and young monks’ training.
description: Lingdum Monastery, also called Ranka Monastery, is a recent but magnificent monastery with golden statues and beautiful murals. It is a popular filming location as well.

name: Phensong Monastery
summary: A monastery known for its annual festival with Cham dances.
description: Phensong Monastery was built in the 18th century and is famous for its annual festival before Losoong. It sits beautifully on a gentle slope in North Sikkim.

name: Phodong Monastery
summary: One of the six important monasteries of the Kagyu sect in Sikkim.
description: Phodong Monastery was founded in the 18th century and is an important monastery of the Kagyu sect. Its Cham festival draws many visitors every year.

name: Ralang Monastery
summary: A modern monastery of the Kagyu order, famous for its architecture.
description: Ralang Monastery, near Ravangla, was built in 1995 and is one of the biggest monasteries in Sikkim. It houses many monks and has a grand annual festival.

name: Kathog Monastery
summary: One of the oldest monasteries in Sikkim, built after the consecration of the first Chogyal.
description: Kathog Monastery is one of the oldest in Sikkim and is closely associated with the establishment of the Namgyal dynasty. It is located in the historic town of Yuksom.
